channel.title: Intellectual jokes
channel.description:
I saw a thread on Reddit the other day with intellectual jokes and boy were they good. Here are some of my favorites:
Q: What's good anagram of Banach-Tarski? A: Banach-Tarski Banach-Tarski.
Q: What does the "B" in Benoit B. Mandelbrot stand for? A: Benoit B. Mandelbrot.
Werner Heisenberg, Kurt Gödel, and Noam Chomsky walk into a bar. Heisenberg turns to the other two and says, "Clearly this is a joke, but how can we figure out if it's funny or not?" Gödel replies, "We can't know that because we're inside the joke." Chomsky says, "Of course it's funny. You're just telling it wrong."
[b]And an original:[/b]
An unorganized room is more entropic than an organized room. Therefore, I shouldn't clean the mess in my room.
Please, share some!

item.title: Intellectual jokes
item.dc:creator: @bowserjr2 Bowser jr
item.description:
@bowserjr2 wrote:


[size=7pt]Hell, my eighth grade science class managed to conclusively reject it just based on a classroom experiment. It’s pretty sad to hear about million-dollar research teams who can’t even manage that.[/size]

Read full topic

yo mama so fat she made godzilla look like an action figure. hahaha GF

As intellectual as they come.

item.title: Intellectual jokes
item.dc:creator: @slavemaster veer
item.description:
@slavemaster wrote:

[quote=“Lin, post:12, topic:523129”][quote author=Niall link=topic=641679.msg4343233#msg4343233 date=1375464450]
Do math jokes count? There are 10 types of people in this world, those who know binary, those who do not, and those who didn’t expect this joke to be in base 3.
[/quote]This doesn’t work. Regardless of whether or not they know the joke is in base 3, they either know binary or they don’t. :)[/quote]

prove it you nonconstructivist

Read full topic

item.title: Intellectual jokes
item.dc:creator: @The_Un-Named The Un-Named
item.description:
@The_Un-Named wrote:

[quote=“Lin, post:12, topic:523129”][quote author=Niall link=topic=641679.msg4343233#msg4343233 date=1375464450]
Do math jokes count? There are 10 types of people in this world, those who know binary, those who do not, and those who didn’t expect this joke to be in base 3.
[/quote]This doesn’t work. Regardless of whether or not they know the joke is in base 3, they either know binary or they don’t. :)[/quote]

Aha! But the joke is a play on the people who think they’re oh so intellectual who think that because they see “10 types of people” they assume it’s a joke about binary. The actual joke is as subtle jab to those types of people who think the joke has a binary outcome!

or, er, something like that

[me=Niall]runs while screaming “GOVERNMENT LIN TOOK MAH BABY SPOTLIGHT”[/me]

Read full topic

item.title: Intellectual jokes
item.dc:creator: @amy_webb1 amy_webb
item.description:
@amy_webb1 wrote:

Two men walk into a bar and sat down at the counter, the first man said the bar tender “i’ll have a glass of H2O” and the bar tender gave the first man a glass of water. The second man turned to the bar tender and said “i’ll have a glass of H2O too”, the second man died.

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @jc22493 Jc22493
item.description:
@jc22493 wrote:

Chrix:

A family consisting of a father, mother, and baby tomato were walking down the road and the baby tomato was lagging behind so the father tomato stepped on the baby tomato and said catchup.

How did the father step on the baby if he was ahead…?

Anyways, I guess this thread isn’t going to work…

Read full topic

Q: What’s good anagram of Banach-Tarski?
A: Banach-Tarski Banach-Tarski.

Heisenberg turns to the other two and says, “Clearly this is a joke, but how can we figure out if it’s funny or not?” Gödel replies, “We can’t know that because we’re inside the joke.” Chomsky says, “Of course it’s funny. You’re just telling it wrong.”
